applicant-information.form-instructions-sin: Please provide your legal name as indicated on your Social Insurance Number (SIN) card or letter.
applicant-information.form-instructions-info: We'll use the information you provide to verify your identity. Any information that does not match the information on your SIN application may cause a delay in the processing of your application.
applicant-information.name-instructions: If using a single legal name, please enter that name in BOTH the first name and last name fields.

communication-preference.note: If eligible, we will share your membership information with Sun Life Assurance Company of Canada (Sun Life), who will be responsible for handling member enrolment and administering claims processing and benefits for the Canadian Dental Care Plan.
communication-preference.preferred-method: What is your preferred method of communication for both Sun Life and the Government of Canada?
communication-preference.preferred-language: What is your preferred official language of communication?
communication-preference.future-email-note: Add your email to receive future communication from Service Canada and Health Canada for the purpose of the Canadian Dental Care Plan.

error-message.empty-method: Preferred method of communication must be selected
error-message.empty-language: Preferred offical language must be selected
error-message.not-the-same: Confirm email is not the same as the entered email

confirm.alert-heading: You have successfully applied for the Canadian Dental Care Plan!
confirm.make-note: Make note of this code, as you will need it to check the status of your application.
confirm.keep-copy: Keep a copy of your application
confirm.print-copy-text: You will not be receiving a confirmation email. It is important to keep a copy of your application. You can use this button to print.
confirm.begin-process: We will begin processing your application immediately.
confirm.cdcp-checker: You can use the <cdcpLink>Canadian Dental Care Plan Status Checker</cdcpLink> or call <noWrap>1-833-537-4342</noWrap> to track the progress of your application.
confirm.use-code: You can use your application code to begin tracking the progress within 48 hours of applying.
confirm.register-msca-title: Register for a My Service Canada Account
confirm.register-msca-text: Once your application is processed, you will be able to sign into <mscaLink>My Service Canada Account (MSCA)</mscaLink> to view or update your personal information. You will also be able to view any letters sent to you from the Government of Canada regarding the Canadian Dental Care Plan.
confirm.msca-notify: You will be notified of your acceptance into the Canadian Dental Care Plan in MSCA.
confirm.how-insurance: How do I use my insurance?
confirm.eligible-text: If you are deemed eligible, Sun Life will send you a welcome package by mail. Your welcome package will include your member card and details about the Canadian Dental Care Plan, including your coverage start date. The Canadian Dental Care Plan will not reimburse you for dental services received before that date.
confirm.more-info-cdcp: For more information on what services and how much will be covered, visit <moreInfoLink>Canadian Dental Care Plan - What is covered</moreInfoLink>.
confirm.ineligible-text: If you are deemed ineligible and your circumstances change that may impact your eligibility for the Canadian Dental Care Plan, you can submit a new application.
confirm.more-info-service: For more information, please contact <dentalContactUsLink>Service Canada</dentalContactUsLink>.
confirm.consent: Consent: My spouse or common-law partner is aware and has consented to sharing of their personal information.
confirm.no-consent: Consent: My spouse or common-law partner is aware and has not consented to sharing of their personal information.

part1.page-title: Voluntary demographic and oral health questions part 1 of 2
part1.paragraph1: Answering the following questions will not impact your application in the CDCP. Providing a response to the questions below is voluntary. Your input, will help Health Canada evaluate and improve the Canadian Dental Care Plan, including understanding if there are potential access or inequity issues.
part1.paragraph2: All responses have an option of "prefer not to answer". All responses are kept confidential and are only used for program monitoring, evaluation and reporting purposes.
part1.question3: 3. Which of the following best describes your racial or ethnic group? Check all that apply:
part1.first-nations: Are you First Nations, Inuk (Inuit), or Métis? First Nations (North American Indian) includes Status and Non-Status Indians. If "Yes," check all that apply.
part1.question4: 4. Do you identify as a person with a disability?
part1.question4-note: A person with a disability is a person who has a long-term difficulty or  condition, such as vision, hearing, mobility, flexibility, dexterity, pain, learning, developmental, memory or mental health-related impairments, that limit their daily activities inside or outside the home such as at school, work, or in the community in general.

part2.page-title: Voluntary demographic and oral health questions part 2 of 2
part2.question-gender: 5. What is your gender? Gender refers to current gender which may be different from sex assigned at birth and may be different from what is indicated on legal documents.
part2.question-mouth-pain: 6. In the past 12 months, how often have you had any persistent or on-going mouth pain? Mouth pain includes pain in teeth, gums, tongue, jaw, jaw joints.
part2.question-last-dental-visit: 7. When was the last time you saw a dentist, denturist, dental hygienist or any other dental specialist? Services may have been provided in any setting where the oral health professional is licensed to practice
part2.question-avoided-dental-cost: 8. In the past 12 months, have you avoided going to a dental professional for dental care due to the cost of care?

optional-demographic-oral-health-questio.page-title: Voluntary demographic and oral health questions
optional-demographic-oral-health-questio.responses-will-be-confidential: The following questions will help Health Canada understand how the program could be improved over time. All responses will be kept confidential.
optional-demographic-oral-health-questio.anwsers-will-not-affect-eligibility: Your answers will not affect your eligibility for the Canadian Dental Care Plan.

dental-benefits.title: Access to other federal, provincial or territorial dental benefits
dental-benefits.access-to-dental: Access to dental coverage through a provincial, territorial or federal government social program will not impact your eligibility for the Canadian Dental Care Plan.
dental-benefits.eligibility-criteria: If you meet all the eligibility criteria, your coverage will be coordinated between the plans to ensure there are no duplication or gaps in coverage.

federal-benefits.title: Federal benefits
federal-benefits.legend: Do you have dental benefits through a social program offered by a federal program?

social-programs.legend: Please select which social program you are covered under. If you have more than one, please select the one you use most.

provincial-territorial-benefits.title: Provincial or territorial benefits
provincial-territorial-benefits.legend: Do you have dental benefits through a social program offered by your province or territory?
provincial-territorial-benefits.option-no: No, I do not have provincial or territorial benefits.

social-programs.input-legend: If yes, through which province or territory?
social-programs.radio-legend: Please select which social program you are covered under. If you have more than one, please select the one you use most.

dental-insurance.title: Access to other dental insurance
dental-insurance.legend: Do you have access to dental insurance or coverage through one of the following four situations?

list.employment: Your employment benefits or a family member's employment benefits, including health and wellness account
list.pension: Your pension benefits or a family member's pension benefits
list.purchased: Purchased by you or a family member or through a group plan from an insurance or benefits company
list.professional: Through a professional or student organization

dental-insurance.option-yes: Yes, I have access to dental insurance or coverage.
dental-insurance.option-no: No, I do not have access to dental insurance or coverage.

additional-info.title: Additional information
additional-info.eligible: Exception: You may still be eligible if you retired and:

list.opted: you opted out of pension benefits before December 11, 2023, and
list.cannot-opt: you can't opt back in under the pension rules

additional-info.not-eligible: You are still considered to have access to dental insurance or coverage if you choose to opt out of benefits provided through your employer/pension (see exception) benefits or through a professional or student organization. As such, you are not eligible for the CDCP.
additional-info.not-eligible-purchased: If you purchased your current dental insurance policy privately on your own (and not as part of any of the coverage described above), you're not eligible for the CDCP while that coverage is in effect.

error-message.required: Access to dental insurance must be selected

radio-options.delegate: I am applying on behalf of someone else

tax-filing.form-instructions: Have you and/or your spouse/common-law partner (if applicable) filed your tax return for 2023 and have received your Notice of Assessment?

date-of-birth.description: Applications for the Canadian Dental Care Plan (CDCP) will open in phases. Your date of birth determines when you can apply.
date-of-birth.form-instructions: Please enter your date of birth

application-delegate.page-title: Applying on behalf of someone cannot be completed online at this time
application-delegate.contact-representative: You must speak to a Service Canada representative to apply on behalf of someone. Please contact Service Canada at 1-833-537-4342 or visit a Service Canada office near you.
application-delegate.prepare-to-apply: <preparingToApply>Preparing to apply on behalf of someone</preparingToApply>

file-your-taxes.ineligible-to-apply: You are not eligible to apply for the Canada Dental Care Plan at this time.
file-your-taxes.tax-not-filed: You and/or your spouse/common-law partner have not filed a tax return for 2023 with the Canada Revenue Agency.
file-your-taxes.unable-to-assess: We use the information from your tax file to verify that you meet the income eligibility for the CDCP. Until you file your 2023 taxes, we won't be able to assess your eligibility.
file-your-taxes.tax-info: For more information on how to file your taxes, visit <taxInfo>Get ready to do your taxes.</taxInfo>
file-your-taxes.apply-after: Please apply for the plan after you have filed your taxes and received your Notice of Assessment.

dob-eligibility.page-title: Find out when you can apply
dob-eligibility.ineligible-to-apply: You are not currently eligible to apply for the Canada Dental Care Plan. Applications for the Canada Dental Care Plan is opening in phases.
dob-eligibility.eligibility-info: <eligibilityInfo>Find out when you can apply for the Canada Dental Care Plan</eligibilityInfo>

index.application-phases: Applications for the CDCP is opening in phases. <whenApplyCDCPLink>Find out when you can apply for the CDCP.</whenApplyCDCPLink>

delegate.delegate-definition: Delegates are individuals who have the legal authority to represent you and make decisions on your behalf.
delegate.delegate-requirements: Before you apply for the CDCP, delegates must provide the powers of attorney, mandates or trusteeship documents that prove they have legal authority to represent you. Original documents or certified copies can be sent by mail or submitted in person at any Service Canada office.
delegate.delegates-on-document: They can represent you if they're listed as your delegate on documents such as:
delegate.document-processing: Once the documents have been processed, a representative will contact the delegate to let them know we've accepted and added the documents to your file. Once they receive this confirmation, the delegate can apply for the CDCP on your behalf.

cover-letter-details.return-address: a return address for us to send the original documents or certified copies back to once we've processed them
cover-letter-details.submission-statement: a statement that the documents are being submitted for the CDCP

by-mail.document-submission-by-mail: If you or the delegate are sending the documents by mail, please include a cover letter that details:
by-mail.heading: By mail

submit-delegate-proof.heading: Submit your proof of delegate documents:

in-person.document-processing-note: We will take a copy of your documents and send them to our processing team.
in-person.document-submission-at-service-canada: If you or the delegate provide the documents at a <serviceCanadaOfficeLink>Service Canada office</serviceCanadaOfficeLink>, please come prepared with:
in-person.heading: In person

apply-behalf.delegate-assisted-cdcp-application: You can apply for the CDCP with the help of a trusted person or a delegate. Both must be done through a Service Canada representative in person at a <serviceCanadaOfficeLink>Service Canada office</serviceCanadaOfficeLink> or by <contactCDCPLink>phone</contactCDCPLink>.
apply-behalf.heading: Applying on behalf of someone else

details.application-assistance: You can ask a trusted person to help you apply by phone or visiting us at a <serviceCanadaOfficeLink>Service Canada office</serviceCanadaOfficeLink>. You must give clear consent that you agree to let them help you. This could be a:

trusted-person.summary: Applying with the help of a trusted person

index.intro-text: The Canadian Dental Care Plan (CDCP) will help ease financial barriers to accessing oral health care for eligible Canadian residents.
index.page-title: Applying for the Canadian Dental Care Plan

details.family-net-income-definition: Your family net income (line 23600 of your tax return plus line 23600 of your spouse's or common-law partner's tax return, and any world income not reported in a tax return to the CRA, such as by a new resident)
details.summary: What is adjusted new family income?
details.uccb-and-rdsp-amounts-repaid: − any UCCB and RDSP amounts repaid (line 21300 and line 23200 of your or your spouse's or common-law partner's tax return)
details.uccb-and-rdsp-income-received: + any universal child care benefit(UCCB) and registered disability savings plan (RDSP) income received (line 11700 and line 12500 of your or your spouse's or common-law partner's tax return)

income.heading: have an adjusted family net income of less than $90,000

access-methods.purchased-insurance: purchased by you or a family member or through a group plan from an insurance or benefits company
access-methods.through-employer-benefits: through your employer or a family member's employer benefits, including health and wellness accounts
access-methods.through-pension-benefits: through your pension (previous employer) or a family member's pension benefits
access-methods.through-professional-or-student-organiza: through a professional or student organization

details.access-to-dental-insurance-definition: "Access to dental insurance" means access to any type of dental insurance or coverage through other channels, such as:
details.opt-out-consideration: You're still considered to have access to dental insurance if you choose to opt out of available benefits like these.
details.summary: What counts as access to dental insurance?

insurance-access.heading: not have access to private dental coverage

conditions.resident-status: be a Canadian resident for tax purposes
conditions.tax-return: have <filedTaxReturnLink>filed your tax return</filedTaxReturnLink> for the previous year and received your Notice of Assessment

to-qualify.heading: To qualify for the CDCP, you must:

what-you-need.heading: What you need before you start:
what-you-need.preparation-instructions: Save time when filling out your application by gathering all the necessary information before you begin. To complete your application, you will need to provide the following information for yourself, and your spouse/common-law partner and dependents (if applicable):

requirements.dental-coverage: List of the dental coverage you have through government social programs (if applicable)

partner-information.provide-sin: Provide information on your current spouse or common-law partner as indicated on their SIN card/letter.
partner-information.required-information: This information is required to calculate the adjusted family net income. Please note that the spouse or common-law partner will need to submit their own application to the plan.
partner-information.name-instructions: If using a single legal name, please enter that name in BOTH the first name and last name fields.
partner-information.confirm-checkbox: I confirm that my spouse or common-law partner is aware and has consented to the sharing of their personal information.

error-message.day: Day must be valid for the given month and year

personal-information.form-instructions: Adding a phone number helps Service Canada contact you if there is an issue with your application. Otherwise, we'll contact you by mail.

home-address.use-mailing-address: My mailing address is the same as my home address

error-message.empty-postal-code: Postal code or Zip code must be provided

review-information.read-carefully: Please review this information carefully. The information provided will be used by Sun Life to create your member account and will be reflected on your member card.
review-information.dental-private-change: Change answer to private dental benefits
review-information.dental-public-change: Change answer to public dental benefits
review-information.dental-has-access: Has access to the following benefits:
review-information.dental-insurance-has-access: Has access to dental insurance or coverage:
review-information.dental-federal-no-access: No access to federal dental benefits
review-information.dental-provincial-no-access: No access to provincial dental benefits
review-information.submit-p-proceed: By proceeding with this application, you are agreeing to attest truthfully to the information provided.
review-information.submit-p-false-info: Submitting false information for you and your family may result in you being removed from the plan and have to repay the full cost of care received through CDCP.

terms-and-conditions.page-heading: Terms and conditions of use and privacy statement
terms-and-conditions.intro-text: We are glad you are using the Canadian Dental Care Plan (CDCP) Online Application ("the Online Application"). We have developed some terms and conditions for using this service ("Terms of Use" or "Terms"). Please read them carefully.

terms-and-conditions-of-use.heading: Terms and Conditions of Use for the Canadian Dental Care Plan Online Application
terms-and-conditions-of-use.online-application-legal-terms: PLEASE READ CAREFULLY these Terms and Conditions of Use for the Canadian Dental Care Plan (CDCP) Online Application are important because they contain information about your legal rights and obligations and regulate your use of the Online Application. These Terms and Conditions of Use should be read in conjunction with the Canada.ca website Terms and Conditions. In case they are differing, the present Terms and Conditions of Use take precedence over Canada.ca Terms and Conditions.
terms-and-conditions-of-use.online-application-access-terms: Your access to and use of the Online Application, including any and all content, is subject to (1) your acceptance of, and (2) your compliance with these Terms of Use.
terms-and-conditions-of-use.online-application-usage-terms: Every time you use the Online Application, these Terms continue to apply. By using the Online Application, you agree to abide by the following Terms. It is your responsibility to understand and retain these Terms.
terms-and-conditions-of-use.terms-rejection-policy: You may always decide not to accept the Terms, in which case you will not be permitted to access and use the Online Application.
terms-and-conditions-of-use.esdc-definition-clarification: In these Terms, "ESDC" refers to the Minister of Employment and Social Development, representing His Majesty the King in Right of Canada.

online-application.heading: Terms of Use of the Online Application:
online-application.self-agreement: Using the Online Application means that you have read and agree to these Terms of Use and the Privacy Notice Statement. If, at any time, you withdraw your agreement to any of the Terms and Conditions of Use you must stop use of the Online Application.
online-application.on-behalf-of-someone-else: If you are using the Application on behalf of another individual, by using the Application, you certify that you have all the necessary authority, permission, and authorities to agree to the Terms of Use on behalf of that individual, and that you agree to the Terms on your own personal behalf and on behalf of the individual you are representing.
online-application.at-your-own-risk: You are using this service at your own risk, and you need to keep any personal information safe. Make sure to close the browser or log out when you are done
online-application.personal-information-usage-responsibilit: You are responsible for how the application is used with your personal information.
online-application.only-use: Only use the Online Application to apply to the Canadian Dental Care Plan.
online-application.maintenance: There will be times when the system might be down for maintenance.
online-application.inactive: If you are inactive for 15 minutes on the Online Application, your session will end and you will lose any information you entered.
online-application.msdc: ESDC uses services from Microsoft Corporation to run the Online Application. The Microsoft data centers used by ESDC are in Canada in accordance with Microsoft Corporation's Terms of Service Agreement.
online-application.antibot: ESDC uses hCaptcha anti-bot services for our online tools in accordance with hCaptcha's <hcaptchaTermsOfService>Terms of Service</hcaptchaTermsOfService>.

disclaimers.heading: Disclaimers
disclaimers.online-application-disclaimer: You understand and agree that ESDC provides the Canadian Dental Care Plan Online Application "as is" with no representation, warranty or guarantee, implied or express, of any kind whatsoever and that ESDC disclaims any and all liability in relation to the use of the Online Application, including any loss, damage or injury arising from or related to:
disclaimers.external-factors-disclaimer: any matters or factors outside of its control, including the availability or unavailability of the internet, or telecommunications or other infrastructure systems; or
disclaimers.online-application-information-non-accep: the non-acceptance of information provided through the Online Application; or
disclaimers.non-compliance: non-compliance with any of these Terms.
disclaimers.esdc-liability-indemnification: I hereby agree to indemnify and hold ESDC harmless from any such liability.

changes-to-these-terms-of-use.heading: Changes to these Terms of Use
changes-to-these-terms-of-use.esdc-terms-amendment-policy: ESDC may amend these Terms of Use at any time and without notice. Such changes shall be effective immediately on the date they are published. By using the Online Application, you agree to abide by the amended Terms. You are responsible to ensure you understand and retain the amended Terms.

personal-information.heading: Personal Information
personal-information.service-canada-application-administratio: Service Canada, which is part of Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC),administers applications for the Canada Dental Care Plan (CDCP) on behalf of Health Canada (HC). Service Canada will collect the personal information you include in your CDCP application to validate eligibility against the CDCP criteria.

how-we-protect-your-privacy.heading: How we protect your privacy
how-we-protect-your-privacy.personal-information-collection-and-use-: The collection and use of your personal information is authorized under the Privacy Act, the Department of Health Act, the Dental Care Measures Act, the Department of Employment and Social Development Act, and other applicable laws.
how-we-protect-your-privacy.personal-information-rights-and-access: You have the right to the protection of, access to, and where applicable, the correction of your personal information. It is kept in the following personal information banks:
how-we-protect-your-privacy.file-hc-ppu-440: Canadian Dental Care Plan HC PPU 440
how-we-protect-your-privacy.info-source-access: You can learn how to access this information in the government publication called <infosource>Info Source</infosource>. You can also access Info Source online at any Service Canada Centre.
how-we-protect-your-privacy.esdc-application-third-party-provider: ESDC carries out this application using services from third-party provider Microsoft Corporation, which may be subject to foreign laws. For more information, see: <microsoftDataPrivacyPolicy>Microsoft Data Privacy Policy & Privacy Principles</microsoftDataPrivacyPolicy>.
how-we-protect-your-privacy.personal-information-handling-complaint-: If you don't agree with the way your personal information was handled by Service Canada, you can contact the Privacy Commissioner of Canada to <fileacomplaint>file a complaint</fileacomplaint>.

who-we-can-share-your-information-with.heading: Who we can share your information with
who-we-can-share-your-information-with.esdc-personal-information-sharing: ESDC will share your personal information with partners in administrating the plan to validate your eligibility and register you for the CDCP.
who-we-can-share-your-information-with.benefits-administration-data-disclosure: Your data may also be disclosed to the CDCP benefits administrator and the benefits administrator's agents and service providers for the purpose of underwriting, verification, administration, adjudication and investigation of claims under CDCP.
who-we-can-share-your-information-with.esdc-information-usage-policy: ESDC may use or share the information you provide for policy analysis, research, monitoring and/or evaluation activities within ESDC and HC. These uses or activities will not affect any administrative decisions made about you.

privacy-notice-statement.what-happens-if-you-dont-give-us-your-in: What happens if you don't give us your information
Participation in the CDCP is voluntary; however, if you do not provide your personal information in your application, you cannot be considered for the CDCP.

apply-now.heading: Apply Now
apply-now.application-start-consent: By starting the application you consent to the above terms and conditions of use and the privacy notice statement.

exit-application.are-you-sure: Are you sure you want to exit this application? If you click "Exit", the form will reset and your information will be lost.
exit-application.click-back: Click "Back" to return to the form.
